newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Rocky road led to Netanyahu-Arafat summit.
newsitem.headline: Rocky road led to Netanyahu-Arafat summit.

text.p: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and Palestinian President Yasser Arafat held their first summit on Wednesday, a meeting which could jumpstart stalled Israel-PLO peace talks.
Following is a chronology of Israel-PLO contacts since Netanyahu took office:
June 18 - Netanyahu takes office promising to promote peace with Israel's Arab neighbours.
June 26 - Netanyahu aide Dore Gold holds secret meetings with senior PLO negotiator Mahmoud Abbas, better known as Abu Mazen.
June 28 - Gold and Netanyahu representative Yitzhak Molho meet Arafat in what senior PLO offical calls "first official contact" with the new Israeli government.
July 16 - PLO officials say Arafat, upset Netanyahu refuses to meet him, rejects Dore Gold request for meeting.
July 23 - Arafat meets Israeli Foreign Minister David Levy in Gaza in first open high-level meeting since Netanyahu took office.
Aug 2 - Netanyahu infuriates Palestinians by lifting a four-year freeze on West Bank Jewish settlement expansion imposed by the previous government.
Aug 9 - Israel says no progress on peace moves until Palestinian Authority (PA) shuts offices in Arab East Jerusalem.
Aug 11 - Arafat threatens Israel with international arbitration if his peace goals are frustrated.
Aug 14 - Israeli-PLO talks on civilian affairs resume.

Aug 22 - Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak says he will cancel a Mideast economic conference if Israel stalls on peace; former Israeli Prime Minister Shimon Peres meets Arafat in Gaza, highlighting Netanyahu's continued refusal to meet the PLO leader.
Aug 25 - Israeli President Ezer Weizman says he will meet Arafat if Netanyahu will not; Palestinian Authority, bowing to Israeli demands, shuts two East Jerusalem offices.

Aug 27 - Israel hoists bulldozer over Jerusalem's Old City wall to demolish a Palestinian community centre it said was built without a permit; Palestinian Trade Minister Maher al-Masri meets Israeli Finance Minister Dan Meridor.
Aug 28 - Arafat says Israel declared war on Palestinians with settlement expansion.

Aug 29 - Palestinians hold first general strike in West Bank and Gaza in two years to protest against Israeli policy; Heads of Israeli-PLO steering committee on implemention of interim peace deals holds first meeting since Netanyahu took office.
Aug 30 - Dore Gold and Abu Mazen hold five hour talks to resolve crisis.
Sept 1 - Israeli and PLO negotiators launch marathon talks with Norwegian mediation aimed at Netanyahu-Arafat meeting.
Sept 4 - Netanyahu and Arafat hold their first summit, at Erez crossing between Israel and Gaza.
